task.title: Create an External Volume Machine Image

context.p: To create an image that boots from an external volume you need to have a pre-existing instance running in Eucalyptus. The following example uses an instance called i-00000000 running in availability zone zone1.
context.note: Make sure that the volume you create is large enough to hold the image you want to boot.

step.cmd: Create a new EBS volume in the same availability zone as the running instance.
step.stepresult: The command displays the ID of the newly-created volume.

step.cmd: Attach the newly-created volume to the instance.
Copy the image (not a bundle) you wish to register to the instance.
On the instance, copy the image onto the block device that corresponds to the EBS volume you attached.
Detach the EBS volume from the instance.

The EBS volumes that EBS-backed images use are created from EBS volume snapshots. When the EBS volume finishes detaching, create a snapshot of it. The command will display the ID of the newly-created snapshot.

When Eucalyptus finishes creating the snapshot, register a new machine image as you would for an instance-store image, but substitute -snapshot and the newly-created snapshot's ID where you would normally supply the path to an image manifest.
step.stepresult: When the command finishes it display the ID of the new EBS-backed machine image.
